org.transitime.db.webstructs

Class WebAgency

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.db.webstructs.WebAgency

  • @Entity
public class WebAgency
extends java.lang.Object
    For keeping track of agency data for a website. Contains info such as the host of the agency so that can use RMI to connect to it.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

      Simple constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • store

        public void store(java.lang.String dbName)
        Stores this WebAgency object in the specified db.
        Parameters:
        dbName - Name of the db that the WebAgency object is stored in

      • getAgency

        public Agency getAgency()
        Returns the first (there can be multiple) GTFS agency object for the specified agencyId. The GTFS agency object is cached. First time it is accessed it is read from server via RMI.
        Returns:
        The Agency object, or null if can't access the agency via RMI

      • getAgencyName

        public java.lang.String getAgencyName()
        Returns the GTFS agency name. It is obtained via RMI as necessary.
        Returns:
        The GTFS agency name

      • getCachedWebAgency

        public static WebAgency getCachedWebAgency(java.lang.String agencyId)
        Gets specified WebAgency from the cache. If the agency is not defined in the cache then will reread the agencies from the database. In this way can add an agency to the database and the system will automatically pick up the new agency.
        Parameters:
        agencyId -
        Returns:
        The specified WebAgency, or null if it doesn't exist.

      • getCachedWebAgencies

        public static java.util.Collection<WebAgency> getCachedWebAgencies()
        Returns collection of all agencies. Values are cached so won't be automatically updated when agencies are changed in the database.
        Returns:

      • getWebAgencies

        public static java.util.Collection<WebAgency> getWebAgencies()
        Returns collection of all agencies as read from database. No caching is done. The database is read each time this method is called, so it should not be used for every API call for example.
        Returns:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
